name: Individual Outpatient Therapy
summary: Individual Outpatient Therapy is a specialized treatment that is personalized to the needs of the individual and recognizes the importance of the individual. We provide quality treatment in areas of anger management, mood disorders, anxiety disorders, attention deficit hyperactivity disorders (ADHD), behavioral disorders, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), stress management, substance abuse disorders, gambling addiction disorders, eating disorders, and obsessive-compulsive disorders.
expectations: Personalized intake to understand your goals and needs
Clear care plan with measurable milestones
Coordinated support from our clinical team
Regular progress check-ins and adjustments

faqs.question: How do I start Individual Outpatient Therapy?
faqs.answer: Call us or request an appointment and our team will guide you through next steps.

faqs.question: Do you accept insurance?
faqs.answer: We can verify benefits and review coverage options before you begin.

faqs.question: What does scheduling look like?
faqs.answer: We offer flexible scheduling based on clinical needs and availability.

name: Comprehensive Clinical Assessment
summary: Each person is assessed to appropriately identify his/her needs/problems and if appropriate, the needs of the family of the person. A clinical screening/assessment/evaluation is conducted on each individual who presents himself/herself for services and/or is referred for assessment, treatment, or evaluation to determine appropriateness for admission and disposition/referral for additional treatment services.
expectations: Personalized intake to understand your goals and needs
Clear care plan with measurable milestones
Coordinated support from our clinical team
Regular progress check-ins and adjustments

faqs.question: How do I start Comprehensive Clinical Assessment?
faqs.answer: Call us or request an appointment and our team will guide you through next steps.

faqs.question: Do you accept insurance?
faqs.answer: We can verify benefits and review coverage options before you begin.

faqs.question: What does scheduling look like?
faqs.answer: We offer flexible scheduling based on clinical needs and availability.

name: SACOT
summary: Substance Abuse Counseling Outpatient Treatment (SACOT) is a structured individual and group addiction activities and services that are provided at an outpatient program designed to assist adults and adolescents to begin recovery and learn skills for recovery maintenance. The program is offered at least 4 hours a day, at least 4 days a week, no more than 7 days a week with no more than 2 consecutive days between offered services, and distinguishes between those individuals needing more than 20 hours of structured services per week.
expectations: Personalized intake to understand your goals and needs
Clear care plan with measurable milestones
Coordinated support from our clinical team
Regular progress check-ins and adjustments

faqs.question: How do I start SACOT?
faqs.answer: Call us or request an appointment and our team will guide you through next steps.

faqs.question: Do you accept insurance?
faqs.answer: We can verify benefits and review coverage options before you begin.

faqs.question: What does scheduling look like?
faqs.answer: We offer flexible scheduling based on clinical needs and availability.

name: SAIOP
summary: Substance Abuse Intensive Outpatient Program (SAIOP) is a structured individual and group addiction activities and services that are provided at an outpatient program with the goals of assisting adults and adolescents to begin recovery and learn life skills for recovery maintenance. The program is offered at least 3 hours a day, at least 3 days a week, with no more than 2 consecutive days between offered services, and distinguishes between those individuals needing no more than 15 hours of structured services per week.
expectations: Personalized intake to understand your goals and needs
Clear care plan with measurable milestones
Coordinated support from our clinical team
Regular progress check-ins and adjustments

faqs.question: How do I start SAIOP?
faqs.answer: Call us or request an appointment and our team will guide you through next steps.

faqs.answer: We can verify benefits and review coverage options before you begin.

faqs.answer: We offer flexible scheduling based on clinical needs and availability.

name: Case Management
summary: Case Management is a service for adults, women who are pregnant and children age three (3) and older who have a serious emotional disturbance, mental illness, or a substance abuse related disorder. Case Management assists recipients in gaining access to necessary care and medical, behavioral, social, housing and other services appropriate to their needs.
expectations: Personalized intake to understand your goals and needs
Clear care plan with measurable milestones
Coordinated support from our clinical team

name: Primary Care – About Us
summary: Stepping Stones Primary Care is committed to being the main point of contact for continuing care for patients within our health care system. We are dedicated to health promotion, disease prevention, health maintenance, counseling, patient education, diagnosis, and treatment.
